content: **shawl construction ** this is a triangle shawl worked in two main parts firstly you will work an elongated triangle sideways increasing every 4 row until the middle point then decreasing every 4 row back to a point this will be the top part of the finished shawl then you will pick up sts along the bottom side of this initial triangle and work downwards with a classic top-down triangle shape increasing 2 sts at the edges and 1 st on each side of a center spine at the end you will work an i-cord all around the shawl **yarn ** you will need three colours of fingering weight yarn in the following amounts ca dark red 320 m 350 yds cb sage green 360 m 395 yds cc dark blue 350 m 385 yds the sample was knit with les petites potions sock 425 m 465 yds / 100 g in cerise noire ca sauge sacrée cb and nuit d orage cc you may want to match the following contrast for an easier chart reading experience ca = darker colour cb = lighter colour cc = medium colour note that the shawl can be worked in only 2 colours replacing cc with either ca or cb every time it is used in the pattern **needles ** 3 75 mm us 5 needles or size required to get gauge **gauge ** 24 sts x 44 row per 10 cm 4 in slipped stitch pattern after blocking note that a different gauge will affect size and yarn usage **size ** 224 cm 88 long x 62 cm 24 ½ deep **notions ** locking stitch markers tapestry needle and scissors row counter recommended **techniques used ** modular sideways and top down triangle shawl simple increases garter and slipped stitch edge slipped stitch and mosaic knitting stockinette and garter stitch lace with eyelets and simple decreases worked on both rs and ws i-cord bind-off and applied i-cord pattern includes charted instructions only for the stitch patterns ----------------------------------------------------------------- **construction du châle ** le châle est un triangle tricoté en deux grandes parties premièrement vous tricoterez un long triangle de pointe à pointe en augmentant tous les 4 rgs jusqu au milieu puis en diminuant tous les 4 rgs jusqu à la seconde pointe ceci constituera la partie haute du châle final ensuite vous relèverez les mailles le long du côté bas de ce triangle initial et tricoterez de haut en bas comme une forme triangulaire classique en augmentant 2 m sur les bords et 1m de chaque côté d une arête centrale pour finir vous tricoterez un i-cord tout autour du châle **laine ** vous aurez besoin de trois couleurs de laine fingering avec les métrages suivants ca rouge foncé 320 m cb vert sauge 360 m cc bleu foncé 350 m le modèle a été tricoté en les petites potions sock 425 m / 100 g coloris cerise noire ca sauge sacrée cb et nuit d orage cc vous pouvez suivre le contraste
